title: Recovering account you have no access to anymore.
body:
So my main account that I played back when the game came out all the way up to the gangplank rework about two years ago I no longer have access to, I for the life of me cannot remember the log in information and have not had access to the e-mail that I signed up for it probably around 2010 / 2011.

I looked online and they said to send in a support ticket but to do it from the e-mail that the account issue has but again I cannot even remember the name of that e-mail. how would I go about trying to fix this? I was hoping to talk to someone on phone support to better explain and give details on the account in hopes of recovering it as I had all the champs up to when I quit playing unlocked on it and a large number of skins and stuff.

Also what the heck happened to the summoner names? I logged into this alt account I made to play with some friends when they wanted to try it out a long time ago and my name was not a random assortment of letters and numbers but it seems to be now.....

replies.body: We have an [account recovery form](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=72416) that will allow you to submit an email address that you do have access to.  Reach out to us through that, and our account team can help with both updating your information as well as recovery.  The name may have been jumbled up as a result of inactivity.  See you there!

So I submitted a ticket the other day and got home from work and went to check on it, When I log into the page and click "My tickets" I just get a page that says My tickets "no request found." Did my ticket derp or something? I have the e-mail saying my ticket went in and to wait for a response but even the link in the e-mail to look at or update the ticket just brings me to a 404 page. Is there any other way of seeing if my ticket actually went in or should I just send another one?

How long should I expect the response and such to wait? also Is there anyway to fix the name without paying for a rename?

What's your ticket number?  I'm happy to check for you, but the AR form doesn't require logging in so you won't see it in the ticketing center.  Instead, you should expect an email with the address you submitted in the form.  Our account team should also be able to assist with a name change at not cost if it was due to inactivity or someone else.

Thank you for the reply, Got home from work today and had a e-mail with all the links needed to fix the account so I won't need help with the ticket. For the name change where would I go for that or would I just submit another ticket?
Glad to hear everything worked out!  I've flagged your name for a change, so you're all set!
